intro: Cyrtandra quercifolia, commonly known as the oak-leaf cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, broad, lobed leaves that resemble those of an oak tree. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale purple, often arranged in clusters. Cyrtandra quercifolia thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation in tropical gardens.
